page.title: A Connoisseur's Guide to Regional Georgian Wines
page.intro: Georgia’s winemaking tradition spans 8,000 years, making it the world’s oldest wine culture. Over 525 indigenous grape varieties thrive here, and winemaking blends ancient Qvevri methods with modern techniques. From the fertile Alazani Valley in the east to the humid Black Sea coast, each region has a distinct terroir and wine personality.

sections.title: Kakheti
sections.intro: Kakheti, eastern Georgia’s wine heartland, has fertile Alazani and Iori valleys with limestone and loess soils. Its climate and deep viticultural history define its rich, structured wines.

winemaking_methods.traditional: Qvevri fermentation and aging for up to six months in buried clay amphorae.
winemaking_methods.modern: Stainless-steel and oak barrel fermentation, sparkling pet-nat, and European-style techniques.

wines.name: Tsinandali
wines.description: Dry white blend of Rkatsiteli and Mtsvane, crisp with floral and green apple notes.

wines.name: Mukuzani
wines.description: Oak-aged Saperavi red, powerful dark fruit, spice, and firm tannins.

wines.name: Kindzmarauli
wines.description: Semi-sweet Saperavi with red-berry liqueur sweetness and velvety texture.

wines.name: Kisi Qvevri
wines.description: Amber white with savory pear notes and tobacco aroma from skin contact aging.

wines.name: Khikhvi Qvevri
wines.description: Full-bodied amber wine with apricot, honey, and exotic herb notes.

sections.title: Kartli
sections.intro: Central Georgia’s Kartli region has moderate plains and fertile loam soils. It favors European-style wines and sparkling, but preserves Qvevri tradition.

winemaking_methods.modern: Stainless-steel, oak barrel aging, traditional method sparkling.

wines.name: Atenuri PDO
wines.description: Sparkling white blend of Chinuri and Goruli Mtsvane, crisp and zesty.

wines.name: Chinuri Still
wines.description: Straw-yellow wine with herbal mint and green pear aromas.

wines.name: Kartli Red Blend
wines.description: Light red from Tavkveri and Shavkapito, cherry-spice character with gentle tannins.

sections.title: Imereti
sections.intro: West-central Georgia’s Imereti has a humid-subtropical climate, varied soils, and a unique short-term skin fermentation (‘Churi’) giving lighter amber wines.

winemaking_methods.traditional: Short Qvevri skin contact (‘Churi’) for weeks.
winemaking_methods.modern: Stainless steel and small oak for fresh whites and rosés.

wines.name: Tsitska–Tsolikouri Blend
wines.description: Pale gold white with floral, melon hints and saline minerality.

wines.name: Tsolikouri
wines.description: Straw-colored wine with citrus and white plum aromas.

wines.name: Krakhuna
wines.description: Late-ripening white with apricot, banana, and honey notes.

wines.name: Otskhanuri Sapere Red
wines.description: Deep red wine with forest fruit and firm tannins.

wines.name: Tvishi
wines.description: Semi-sweet white from high-altitude Tsolikouri, golden and peachy.

wineries: Local family marani near Gelati Monastery

sections.title: Racha-Lechkhumi
sections.intro: Mountainous Racha’s high-altitude vineyards on calcareous soils yield distinct semi-sweet reds and elegant whites.

winemaking_methods.traditional: Terroir-driven foot-treading and Qvevri for Khvanchkara.

wines.name: Khvanchkara
wines.description: Protected semi-sweet red blend of Aleksandrouli and Mujuretuli, with raspberry, cherry, and honey flavors.

wines.name: Tvishi White
wines.description: Semi-sweet Tsolikouri, apricot, melon, and delicate honey flavors.

wines.name: Dry Aleksandrouli
wines.description: Light red with black-fruit and earthy notes.

sections.title: Adjara & Guria
sections.intro: Georgia’s Black Sea coast with humid climate produces aromatic reds and rosés, historically trained on trees to avoid ground moisture.

winemaking_methods.traditional: Small-scale cellar Qvevri often abandoned for humidity control.
winemaking_methods.modern: Clean-room stainless fermentation, some sparkling and sun-dried dessert styles.

wines.name: Ojaleshi Red
wines.description: Herbal spicy red with strawberry, black pepper, and cedar notes.

wines.name: Chkhaveri Rosé
wines.description: Soft salmon pink rosé with strawberry jam and lychee perfume.
